item.title: StarSpace46 literally takes co-working to next level
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Having maxed out the first floor of a two-story converted industrial building, StarSpace46 co-working space is expanding upward to make room for its growing client base. The co-working space (an in-kind sponsor of Free Press) opened October 2016 and immediately started filling it’s first floor offices, co-working areas, and heavily-booked meeting space over the last […]

The post StarSpace46 literally takes co-working to next level appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Amazon incentive deal approved by OKC Council over objections
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Two Oklahoma City Council members challenged a $1.7 million Amazon incentive deal as being unnecessary for Amazon to build a distribution center in the metro. In the end, it passed. The public was not able to know about the proposal until late on a Friday afternoon only four days before it was taken up in […]

The post Amazon incentive deal approved by OKC Council over objections appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Amazon deal one step closer after Econ Dev Trust vote
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The Oklahoma City Economic Development Trust voted Tuesday to offer a $1.7 million incentive to Amazon to bring a new fulfillment center to the metro in exchange for job guarantees. The Trust turned in a unanimous vote for the measure. Next, the deal will go before the full Oklahoma City Council for a decision on […]

The post Amazon deal one step closer after Econ Dev Trust vote appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Elemental Coffee customers confident, joking after roaster fire
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Customers at Elemental Coffee, 815 N. Hudson, had some excitement on what would have been a sleepy afternoon when the roaster developed an internal fire during Monday. But, only a few got up and left. The rest stayed, including this reporter who was working only feet away from the roaster when the fire began. One […]

The post Elemental Coffee customers confident, joking after roaster fire appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Streetcar project construction threatens Automobile Alley merchants
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Gary Goldman stepped onto the patio of his Cultivar Mexican Kitchen restaurant, pulled out his cell phone and started frantically texting. Streetcar line construction vehicles had collected in front of the building on N. Broadway Ave blocking parking and the view of his restaurant at the beginning of lunchtime Thursday. His lunch customers are what’s […]

The post Streetcar project construction threatens Automobile Alley merchants appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Red Rooster redo promises to revive neighborhood tavern near Paseo
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The Red Rooster Bar has been a neighborhood institution at 3100 N. Walker since 1937 and it’s about to get a long-overdue remodeling. The new proprietors and the construction company doing the remodeling see potential in the space that has some classic features but also the challenges of eliminating the smell of smoke from 81 […]

The post Red Rooster redo promises to revive neighborhood tavern near Paseo appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: OKC Econ Development Trust green-lights $2.6 million for incentives
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Two very different projects moved one step closer Tuesday toward receiving a total of $2.6 million from city coffers for incentives if approved later by the City Council. Among other agenda items, the Oklahoma City Economic Development Trust approved one project from a federal contractor wanting to move into OKC. The other was for a […]

The post OKC Econ Development Trust green-lights $2.6 million for incentives appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Sean Cummings developing new northside Irish restaurant
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Sean Cummings is going to open Sean’s Irish Restaurant, a new Irish-themed establishment around the end of March and his long-time customers are acting like kids the night before Christmas. Every time he posts something new about it on Facebook a flood of customers who like his current Bacon restaurant, but remember his former place, […]

The post Sean Cummings developing new northside Irish restaurant appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Village voters say yes to streets, parks, capital improvements
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Bacon Restaurant on N. May was especially festive for a Tuesday night. Owners Cathy and Sean Cummings were hosting a watch party for a historic vote. Voters in The Village approved a permanent sales tax increase and two general obligation bond propositions Tuesday by large margins. Four of the five city council members and other […]

The post Village voters say yes to streets, parks, capital improvements appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Even on New Year’s Day, small shops open for “neighbors”
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Ben Nockels spends a good part of his days in Commonplace Books, a locally owned bookstore he helped start in midtown near NW 13th Street and N. Walker. Monday, New Year’s Day, was no different for him and his big, white dog that silently glides through the bookstore surprising people with his gentleness. Nockels was […]

The post Even on New Year’s Day, small shops open for “neighbors” appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.
